tools.module_execution.auto_column module¶

tools.module_execution.camera_execution module¶

:mod:”camera_execution” – Mid-level hack to change camera recording speed¶

  1. 2018 The Cronin Group, University of Glasgow

This class provides a method to change the frame rate of a video log which may or may be recorded. This is accomplished by logging messages at a level below DEBUG containing the requested recording speed (in multiples of real time). The beauty of this approach is that a) most of the complicated message passing is handled by the logging module, and b) if no recording is running, the workings of this module are entirely without consequence because all other loggers reject this level.

For style guide used see http://xkcd.com/1513/

class tools.module_execution.camera_execution.CameraExecutioner[source]¶

Bases: object

Class to change camera recording speed

TODO: add try/except statements to catch calls to unsupported methods!

change_recording_speed(recording_speed)[source]¶

Method to change the camera recording speed. This method simply logs a message at level 5 (below DEBUG), which may or may not be intercepted by an appropriate vlogging handler.

Parameters

recording_speed (int) – Requested recording speed (in multiples of real time speed)

tools.module_execution.chiller_execution module¶

:mod:”chiller_execution” – Mid-level wrapper class around :mod:”JULABO_CF41”¶

  1. 2017 The Cronin Group, University of Glasgow

This class provides all real-life applications of recirculation chillers within the Chemputer rig, essentially just wrapping the original class methods.

For style guide used see http://xkcd.com/1513/

Sets the cooling power of the chiller. Only works with Julabo CF41.

Parameters

  • cooling_power (int) – Cooling power in % (range 0..100)

tools.module_execution.pump_execution module¶

:mod:”pump_execution” – Mid-level wrapper class around :mod:”Chemputer_Device_API”¶

  1. 2017 The Cronin Group, University of Glasgow

This class provides all real-life applications of pumps and valves within the Chemputer rig, most notably the path finding algorithm and the moving of material based on that. It also has some compound operations like phase separation that are needed to operate the Chemputer rig.

For style guide used see http://xkcd.com/1513/

class tools.module_execution.pump_execution.PumpExecutioner(graph, pumps, valves, simulation)[source]¶

Bases: object

Executes the Pump movements around the platform_server .. note:: Ignore the style faux pas of the simulation statements on a single line, it’s better than taking up two

lines for something that will rarely be used!

clean_all(source, volume)[source]¶

Iterates over all valves, and pumps a given volume from the source to each outlet.

Parameters

  • source (str) – flask from which the fluid should be withdrawn

  • volume (float) – volume to be transferred

get_current_node_volume(node)[source]¶

Checks whether the node in question is a special device (filter, separator, rotavap, …). If so, returns volume of the associated flask, else returns node volume. I realise this helper is written in a verbose way, but this is done on purpose for future proofing (maybe there will be other cases that are not as straightforward as the ones currently implemented!).

Parameters

node – (str) Name of the node to check

Returns

(float) Current volume of the node.

Return type

current_node_volume

get_maximum_node_volume(node)[source]¶

Checks whether the node in question is a special device (filter, separator, rotavap, …). If so, returns maximum volume of the associated flask, else returns node volume. I realise this helper is written in a verbose way, but this is done on purpose for future proofing (maybe there will be other cases that are not as straightforward as the ones currently implemented!).

Parameters

node – (str) Name of the node to check

Returns

(float) Maximum volume of the node.

Return type

maximum_node_volume

home(pump, speed)[source]¶

Moves the target pump into the home position

Parameters

  • pump (str) – Name of the pump to home

  • speed (int) – Speed to move in milliliters per minute

is_valid_obj(flag, obj)[source]¶

Determines if the the passed object is either a ChemputerPump or ChemputerValve, depending on the passed flag

Parameters

  • flag (str) – Type of object to check for

  • obj (Object) – Object to compare

Returns

The object is of the expected type

Return type

valid (bool)

Raises

Exception – The object is not of the expected type

move(path, volume, move_speed, aspiration_speed=None, dispense_speed=None)[source]¶

Performs the movement around the platform_server Uses either a single valve or multiple valves :param list path: List containing the path from the source to the destination and all valves in between :param float volume: Total volume to move in mL :param float move_speed: speed in mL/min for the moving along :param float aspiration_speed: speed in mL/min for the initial aspiration. Defaults to move_speed :param float dispense_speed: speed in mL/min for the final dispensing. Defaults to move_speed

move_multiple_valves(valves, source, dest, volume, aspiration_speed, move_speed, dispense_speed)[source]¶

Performs the movement with multiple valves Occurs when the path has multiple connections E.g. [source_flask, valve1, valve2, valve2, destination_flask]

Parameters

  • valves (list) – Names of the valves

  • source (str) – Name of the source flask

  • dest (str) – Name of the destination flask

  • volume (float) – Volume to move in mL

  • aspiration_speed (float) – Speed in mL/min for the initial aspiration

  • move_speed (float) – Speed in mL/min for the moves across the backbone

  • (float (dispense_speed) – Speed in mL/min for the final dispensing

move_single_valve(valve, source, dest, volume, aspiration_speed, dispense_speed)[source]¶

Performs the movement with a single valve This occurs when the path would be [source_flask, valve, destination_flask]

Parameters

  • valve – (str) Name of the valve

  • source – (str) Name of the source flask

  • dest – (str) Name of the destination flask

  • volume – (float) Volume to move in mL

  • aspiration_speed – (float) Speed in mL/min for the initial aspiration

  • dispense_speed – (float) Speed in mL/min for the final dispensing

prime_tubes(aspiration_speed)[source]¶

Iterates over all nodes, and for all flasks moves the volume of the connecting tube from the flask to waste. :param aspiration_speed: Speed at which to withdraw from each flask :type aspiration_speed: float

separate_phases(lower_phase_target, upper_phase_target, separator_top='flask_separator_top', separator_bottom='flask_separator_bottom', step_size=1, threshold=700)[source]¶

Routine for separating layers in the automated sep funnel based on the conductivity sensor. Draws a known amount into the tube, measures response, then keeps removing portions until the response drops below the threshold. The implementation of the sensor is still insanely crude, basically an Arduino hack I shat together in a minute. Probably worthwhile changing at some point.

Parameters

  • lower_phase_target (str) – name of the flask the lower phase will be deposited to

  • upper_phase_target (str) – name of the flask the upper phase will be deposited to

  • separator_top (str) – name of the node which the sensor is associated with

  • separator_bottom (str) – name of the location the lower phase is to be withdrawn from

  • step_size (float) – size of the individual withdrawals in mL

  • threshold (int) – minimum sensor reading indicating aqueous phase

switch_cartridge(flask, cartridge)[source]¶

Crude hack to swicht a cartridge carousel consisting of two valves. Assumes identical ports are connected, i.e. port 0 to 0, 1 to 1 etc.

Parameters

  • flask (str) – node the carousel is connected to

  • cartridge (int) – number of the cartridge to switch to

switch_column_fraction(column, destination)[source]¶

Crude hack for switching the fractionating valve on the flash column.

Parameters

  • column (str) – column which is to be switched

  • destination (str) – either “collect” or “waste”

switch_vacuum(flask, destination)[source]¶

Crude hack for switching a flask to vacuum via attached valve.

Parameters

  • flask (str) – flask which is to be evacuated

  • destination (str) – either “vacuum” or “backbone”

update_node_volumes(source, target, volume)[source]¶

Checks whether either source or target node is a special device (filter, separator, rotavap, …). If so, updates the volumes of the associated flask as appropriate. Else, updates the node directly.

Parameters

  • source – (str) Name of the source node

  • target – (str) Name of the target node

  • volume – (float) Volume moved

tools.module_execution.vacuum_execution module¶

:mod:”vacuum_execution” – Mid-level wrapper class around :mod:”Vacuubrand_CVC_3000”¶

  1. 2017 The Cronin Group, University of Glasgow

This class provides all real-life applications of vacuum pumps within the Chemputer rig, essentially just wrapping the original class methods. It also has a “vent to ambient pressure” function for convenience.

For style guide used see http://xkcd.com/1513/
